geninfo.para: This TSI applies to 2000, 4000, and 8000 Series vehicles with air conditioning.

The air conditioning drip tray in some 2000, 4000 and 8000 Models may be mounted incorrectly, causing the tray to become twisted, allowing water to drip onto the floor of the cab. If this condition exists, the following procedure will correct the condition.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE

step1.para: Remove the screws that hold the lower right instrument panel in place, and remove the panel along with the drip tray. On the backside of the panel are two pins molded into the panel. These two pins go into two holes on the edge of the air conditioning drip tray. The tray is held in place by a tinnerman clip on each pin. The reason the drip tray twists out of shape which allows water to drip on the cab floor is because the two holes in the edge of the drip pan are located incorrectly.

Use a pair of side cutter pliers to cut the tinnerman clip on each pin at its narrowest part. Carefully remove the tinnerman clips from the pins because rough handling may cause the pins to break off.
Remove the tray and drill a new 1/4 inch hole, 1/2 inch to the left of each hole in the edge of the tray. ( Figure 1).

Handle the instrument panel with care while positioning the two pins in the new holes in the tray because rough handling may cause the pin(s) to break off. Carefully secure the tray on the pins with new tinnerman clips, Pt# 146327R1
Re-install the drain end of the tray through the hole in the dash. Secure the instrument panel with the screws removed in step 1.

svcproc.para: If after removal, the drip tray is badly deformed, it may be necessary to replace it. Order a new tray, Pt# 581673C3, from Service Parts. The holes in the edge of the new tray will not have to be relocated.
